rev.comment: /* Police violence at Occupy UC Davis */ restore deleted videos per talk
rev.diff:
Line 29: Line 29:
==Police violence at Occupy UC Davis==
==Police violence at Occupy UC Davis==
{{POV-section|date=November 2011}}
{{POV-section|date=November 2011}}
  +
[[File:OccupyUCD3.jpg|thumb|450px|UC Davis Police officer Lieutenant John Pike uses pepper spray on passive, seated Occupy demonstrators]]
  +
{{external media
  +
| align = right
  +
| width =
  +
| video1= [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6AdDLhPwpp4 UC Davis Protestors Pepper Sprayed , Nov 18]
  +
| video2= [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WmJmmnMkuEM Excerpt: Police pepper spraying and arresting students at UC Davis , Nov 18]
  +
| video3= [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n3A0d9fHWag Extended: UC Davis Riot Police part 1 , Nov 18]
  +
| video4= [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DjXk9wYWIE8 Extended: UC Davis Riot Police part 2, Nov 18]
  +
| video5= [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NwFa5Kq4Rfo Extended: UC Davis Riot Police part 3, Nov 18]
  +
| video6=[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8775ZmNGFY8 UC Davis Chancellor Katehi walks to her car , Nov 19]
  +
}}
On November 18, 2011, Chancellor Katehi ordered [[Occupy movement]] protesters on the UC Davis campus to remove their tents from the quad. When a group of protestors engaged in [[nonviolence|nonviolent]] [[civil disobedience]] refused to move, campus police officers [[pepper spray]]ed them.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2011/11/20/us/california-occupy-pepperspray/index.html|title=California university launches inquiry into pepper spray of protesters|publisher=CNN|accessdate=2011-11-20}}</ref> Eleven protesters received medical treatment; two were hospitalized.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.davisenterprise.com/local-news/crime-fire-courts/protests-again-gathering-steam-on-campus/|title=UCD to review pepper-spraying, clearing of protesters|publisher=Davis Enterprise|accessdate=2011-11-19}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | newspaper=[[The Cleveland Leader]] | title=UC Davis Police Brutally Pepper Spray OWS Protesters Sitting Peacefully on Campus | url=http://www.clevelandleader.com/node/17846 | first=Julie | last= Kent | date= 19 November 2011 | accessdate = 21 Nobember 2011}}</ref> Nathan Brown, assistant professor at UC Davis, said, "One of them, forty-five minutes after being pepper-sprayed down his throat, was still coughing up blood." <ref name="independent_adams">Guy Adams, [http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/outcry-over-chilling-campus-pepper-spray-use-6265203.html Outcry over 'chilling' campus pepper spray use], [[The Independent]], 20 November, 2011</ref> The police have not responded to these claims.
On November 18, 2011, Chancellor Katehi ordered [[Occupy movement]] protesters on the UC Davis campus to remove their tents from the quad. When a group of protestors engaged in [[nonviolence|nonviolent]] [[civil disobedience]] refused to move, campus police officers [[pepper spray]]ed them.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2011/11/20/us/california-occupy-pepperspray/index.html|title=California university launches inquiry into pepper spray of protesters|publisher=CNN|accessdate=2011-11-20}}</ref> Eleven protesters received medical treatment; two were hospitalized.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.davisenterprise.com/local-news/crime-fire-courts/protests-again-gathering-steam-on-campus/|title=UCD to review pepper-spraying, clearing of protesters|publisher=Davis Enterprise|accessdate=2011-11-19}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | newspaper=[[The Cleveland Leader]] | title=UC Davis Police Brutally Pepper Spray OWS Protesters Sitting Peacefully on Campus | url=http://www.clevelandleader.com/node/17846 | first=Julie | last= Kent | date= 19 November 2011 | accessdate = 21 Nobember 2011}}</ref> Nathan Brown, assistant professor at UC Davis, said, "One of them, forty-five minutes after being pepper-sprayed down his throat, was still coughing up blood." <ref name="independent_adams">Guy Adams, [http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/outcry-over-chilling-campus-pepper-spray-use-6265203.html Outcry over 'chilling' campus pepper spray use], [[The Independent]], 20 November, 2011</ref> The police have not responded to these claims.
